intro: Lipochaeta degeneri, commonly known as the slender lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Lipochaeta degeneri is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and sandy heathlands.
